item.title: Echo Canyon Road Trail Guide
item.description: An easy rock road accessing the Inyo Mine from Hwy 190 in Death Valley National Park. The Backcountry and Wilderness Access Map describes the trail as high clearance for the first three miles and 4x4 required beyond. In April 2023, this road was flat and smooth and did not require either along the mellow but constant 3,500' climb up to the mine. This canyon was flooded and closed after storms in August 2022, but the washouts may have evened out the trail. Notable features include small rock arches above the canyon walls, including the Eye of the Needle. Dispersed camping is allowed along this road, but as of Winter 2023, free backcountry camping permits are required.

item.title: Echo Canyon Road Trail Guide
item.description:
Echo Canyon Road Trail Guide
An easy rock road accessing the Inyo Mine from Hwy 190 in Death Valley National Park. The Death Valley Backcountry and Wilderness Access Map describes Echo Canyon as high clearance the first three miles and 4x4 required beyond. In April 2023, this road was flat and smooth and did not require either along the mellow but constant 3,500' climb up to the mine. This canyon was flooded (and subsequently closed) after heavy storms in August 2022, so perhaps the storms evened out the trail. In addition to the Inyo Mine, additional features along this trail are small rock arches in the canyon walls above. The most notable is the Eye of the Needle Arch. Dispersed camping is allowed along Echo Canyon Road but as of Winter 2023, free backcountry camping permits are now required.

item.title: Echo Canyon Road Trail Guide (Death Valley)
item.description: Prep your high-clearance 4x4 or Can-Am Maverick X3 for Echo Canyon Road near Death Valley with the right tires, recovery kit, and communications setup.

item.title: Beatty Narrows Trail Guide
item.description:
{ Â "title": "Beatty Narrows Trail Guide (Nevada)", Â "category": "trail-guide", Â "description": "Beatty Narrows is a popular off-road route located just outside Beatty, Nevada. This scenic desert trail cuts between volcanic rock walls and offers sweeping views of the Amargosa Valley. The terrain consists of compact dirt, gravel sections, shallow wash crossings, and mild rocky steps. Itâ€™s a great beginner-to-intermediate trail with plenty of photo opportunities and side routes to explore.
Trail Rating: Moderate Route Type: Out-and-back Best Time to Visit: Fall through spring Nearby Landmark: Death Valley National Park Elevation: ~3,300â€“3,700 ft
Recommended Vehicle: Can-Am Maverick X3 or any high-clearance 4x4/UTV.
Key Highlights: â€“ Narrow desert canyon scenery â€“ Easy access from town â€“ Smooth, flowing terrain suitable for beginners â€“ Great testing ground for suspension, tires, recovery gear, and comms
Affiliate Gear Mentions: â€“ Recovery boards â€“ Soft shackles â€“ Tire repair kit â€“ Portable air compressor â€“ Midland GMRS radio â€“ LED rock lights â€“ First aid kit â€“ Portable power bank ", Â "assets": { Â Â "features": [ Â Â Â "Narrow canyon walls", Â Â Â "Smooth desert terrain", Â Â Â "Gravel and small rock steps", Â Â Â "Side wash crossings", Â Â Â "Wide valley views" Â Â ], Â Â "trail_context": "Beatty, Nevada desert canyon with volcanic rock formations, gravel terrain, shallow wash crossings, and clear line-of-sight trail sections.", Â Â "keywords": [ Â Â Â "Beatty Narrows", Â Â Â "Beatty Nevada trails", Â Â Â "off-road trail Nevada", Â Â Â "desert canyon trail", Â Â Â "Can-Am Maverick X3 Nevada" Â Â ] Â } }

item.title: Tin Cup Pass test3
item.description:
Tin Cup Pass, Colorado
Tin cup Pass is a historic, high-elevation mountain pass in Colorado, popular for high-clearance 4x4 off-roading, ATV/UTV riding, and hiking. It crosses the Continental Divide at 12,154 feet and connects the historic ghost town of St. Elmo to the small residential community of Tincup
Trail Difficulty: Moderate

item.title: Tin Cup Pass Test4
Tin Cup Pass Test4
item.description:
Tin Cup Pass, Colorado

Tin cup Pass is a historic, high-elevation mountain pass in Colorado, popular for high-clearance 4x4 off-roading, ATV/UTV riding, and hiking. It crosses the Continental Divide at 12,154 feet and connects the historic ghost town of St. Elmo to the small residential community of Tincup


Trail difficulty: moderate

item.title: Tin Cup Pass Test3
item.description:
Tin Cup Pass, Colorado

Tin Cup Pass is a historic, high-elevation mountain pass in Colorado, popular for high-clearance 4x4 off-roading, ATV/UTV riding, and hiking. It crosses the Continental Divide at 12,154 feet and connects the historic ghost town of St. Elmo to the small residential community of Tincup


Trail Rating: Moderate
